result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Peter L. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter L. Erickson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Peter L. Erickson was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Peter L. Erickson was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
If arrested or named as a defendant in any jurisdiction must notify the DA's office in writing within 10 days.
No contact of any kind with Krista Buckpitt, nor shall he cause her to be contacted.
Refrain from possessing, ingesting, inhaling or otherwise introducting into his body illegal drugs and prescription drugs not specially prescribed for him.
At the request of any Oneida County law enforcement officer, defendant shall report to Oneida County Sheriff's Dept within 24 hours with all prescription drugs and medications for which he then has a valid prescription, to permit law enforcement officers to conduct a pill count.
Obtain prescription medications only from Walgreens pharamacies and only pursuant to prescriptions obtained from physicians in the employ of the Veteran's Administration or Ministry Health Group, except in the case of a medical emergency, in which case the Defendant shall report and explain his deviation from this provision to the Oneida County DA's office within 10 days.
Within 10 days of obtaining prescription medicine, provide a copy of the prescription for said medication to Oneida County DA's office.
Sign all necessary releases allowing the Oneida County DA's office to monitor compliance with the Agreement.
Inform DA's office in writing of any change of address and/or telephone number within 10 days of such change.
Comply with bond conditions.
Pay all court-imposed financial obligations associated with Counts 2 and 3.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter L. Erickson

records.addlTxt: 3:21 p.m. Defendant Peter L. Erickson not in court.  Mary Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sowinski statement to compliance. State moves to dismiss - Granted. Adj. 3:21 p.m.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:08 a.m. Defendant Peter L. Erickson in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss but Count 1 - Granted. Plea Questionnaire filed. Deferred Entry of Judgment filed. Defendant enters guilty plea to Counts 2 and 3. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 4.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Schultz statement on plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty on Counts 2 and 3. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists, accepts plea but defers entry and accepts Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement on Count 4. Bednar/Schultz/Court statement on sentencing. 
Count 2 - Court imposes fine of $1,000 plus costs.
Count 3 - Court imposes costs only.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 10:24 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for March 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm. Review date for DEJ to be set at that time.
From ADA Bednar, cancel MH on 2/26/16.  She will be scheduling a plea/sentencing hearing.

Defendant Peter L. Erickson in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:16
Schiek statement - no agreement as of yet- Schultz statement - now files motion to dismiss/ or diclose CI and previous motion for full discovery and motion to suppress still outstanding - now wants hearing for all 3 motions - requesting about 1 1/2 hours 
Bail continued  Motion hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Amended Motion to Suppress Defendant's Statements
to Compel Discovery or Sanctions  - includes cover letter

10:59 a.m. Defendant Peter L. Erickson in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files Information - Schultz - in receipt of Information - waive reading - enters not guilty plea  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

11:03 am. Defendant Peter L. Erickson in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Deputy Ryan Rossing, ONSO/sworn/direct by Michlig -  Witness ID's defendant - Cross by Schultz. Statement by Schultz. Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial. State to file Information. Bail continued. Adj. 11:25 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:45 am.

02:21 pm - Defendant Peter L. Erickson in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.

01:27 pm - Defendant Peter L. Erickson in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will obtain counsel, Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
